column4: how to i explicitly see my dns entries on the system. and tell them to refresh from a nameserver explicitly?
you can set them in /etc/resolv.conf   but network manager will overwrite it if its used next boot
is it possible to which dns server i'm pinging for "ping <website>"
resolv.conf gives my routers ip. is there some way i can explicitly ask it to refresh / repopulate the dns entries
thats because your router is providing a proxy DNS
you can restart networking but you will just get the same DNS due to the DHCP
will resolv.conf take multilines eg nameserver \t ip1 \n nameserver \t ip2
sure, you can add as many as you like, if you run dnsmasq you will need to add localhost as a nameserver too
dnsmasq will give you a local dns and reduce the need the system to ask the web for name resolution
when i replaced nameserver with a newone ,it just took longer to show page not found in firefox. ping timedout as well
ha thanks, i just opened the same page
keep the original, just add the name servers you wanna use. Make sure you add them by IP
if dig <website> @nameserver works, but dig <website> says ServFail , what does that mean
if you use network manager, it will change it back
if you install and configure dnsmasq your resolutions will be instantaneous
rather than querying the web which takes tiiiime
